subject: Entrepreneurship
title: The Danger of Premature Scaling
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Danger of Premature Scaling.

hook.text: A startup raises $10M, hires 50 people, and opens three offices. Six months later, they're dead.

buildup.text: The Startup Genome Project found that premature scaling kills 74% of high-growth startups.

discovery.text: Premature scaling means spending big before proving the model. Hiring before retention. Ads before word-of-mouth.

twist.text: More money often accelerates failure. It lets founders scale mistakes instead of fixing them.

climax.text: Webvan scaled to 26 cities before proving unit economics in one. They burned through $800M.

punchline.text: Scaling a broken model just breaks it faster.

quiz.question: What did the Startup Genome Project find about premature scaling?
options: It leads to faster profitability in most cases
